entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 12:54PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ANOTHER HEAT WAVE LIKELY THIS WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... Widespread hot temperatures are expected to develop again this weekend with highs in the upper 70s into the 80s for the inner channels. Locations away from the water will be the warmest. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 10:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOODING FROM LAKE DRAINAGE NEAR NUIQSUT... A lake 23 miles west of Nuiqsut is expected to drain rapidly into Judy Creek and Fish Creek sometime in the next two weeks, impacting camps downstream. Water levels are expect to rise 2 to 6 feet over a 12 to 24 hour period once it releases.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:20PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cooler and Breezy 4th of July Holiday Weekend... * A cold front will bring temperatures down to 5-15 degrees below average Sunday and Monday. Highs in the lower to mid 80s are expected in the lower elevations, with upper 60s to lower 70s in Sierra valleys. For many areas this could be the coolest July 4th since 2000. entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.summary: ...Trough of low pressure to bring gusty winds through the weekend... .A low pressure trough impacting the West Coast will bring gusty winds to portions of the state over the weekend. entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... Very warm and dry conditions expected over the holiday weekend.
